title: Hindustan
summary:
Hindustan (Persian: هندوستان pronunciation ) pronounced as (hiːndostɒːn or hin-DOU-stan), along with its shortened form Hind (هند),[1] is the Persian name for India, broadly the Indian subcontinent, which later became used by its inhabitants in Hindi–Urdu (Hindustani).[2][3][4][5] Other toponyms of the subcontinent include Jambudvipa, Bharata, and India.
After the Partition of India, it continues to be used as a historic name for the Republic of India.[6][7][8]
